page.title: 18Pocket money
page.content: Out of 102 children at a local primary school aged 5 to 11 years the largest amount of pocket money recieved is Â£12.50. The smallest amount recieved is 2p. The most common amount is Â£1.00. 28 out of the 102 save their pocket money, 26 children spend it on sweets, and 8 spend it on toys; the remainder spend it on a variety of items depending on their feelings and needs. With Â£1.00 a child could buy a packet of crisps for 12p, a bar of chocolate for 50p, a comic for 20p and a newspaper for 18p. If a child's mother gives a child Â£5.00 or more, she usually gives it to them @ Â£1.00 a day. The average amount of pocket money for the 102 children was less than Â£1.00 per day.
